Title: Neurogenomics Laboratory
Department: UK Dementia Research Institute, Department of Brain Sciences
Bullet_1: Thesis: Multi-omic medicine: dissecting the cell-type-specific molecular mechanisms underlying neurodegenerative disease genomics.
Bullet_2: Objective: Computationally dissect the subtraits, cell-types underlying the genomic signatures of Alzheimer's Disease and Parkinson's Disease.

Title: 120/80 MKTG
Bullet_1: Offers consultation services to a wide portfolio of high-profile digital healthcare companies, with a focus on data analytics, research publication, and strategic transparency.
Bullet_2: Provides data-driven business intelligence reports using proprietary software scientific literature mining software that I have created.

Title: Raj Laboratory
Institution: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Department: Department of Neuroscience / Department of Neurology / Department of Genetics & Genomics / Ronald M. Loeb Center for Alzheimer's Disease
Bullet_1: Developed machine learning systems to integrate large-scale multi-omics datasets (e.g. whole-genome sequencing, bulk and single-cell RNA-seq, epigenomics, clinical data) to uncover the molecular mechanisms underlying neurodegenerative diseases (e.g. Alzheimer's, Parkinson's, ALS).
Bullet_2: Computationally identified specific disease-causal variants, pathways and cell-types for subsequent functional wet lab validation (e.g. CRISPR-cas9 editing in patient-derived cell cultures, iPSCs and cerebral organoids).

Title: Ma'ayan Laboratory
Institution: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Bullet_1: Conducted computational systems biology research. Integrated and analyzed large-scale genomic and biomedical data (e.g. Python, R, JavaScript).
Bullet_2: Developed evolutionary algorithm to optimize gene network kinase regulator prediction (eXpression2Kinases).
Bullet_3: Developed and deployed computational tools, software, databases and web applications for basic and clinical research, resulting in 3 peer-reviewed publications.

Title: Systems Genetics in Neurodegeneration
Supervisor: Rupert Overall, PhD / Robert Williams, PhD / Gerd Kempermann, PhD / Rudi Balling, PhD
Bullet_1: Attended lectures and extended skills in extraction and analysis of big data from biomedical and neurogenomic resources.
Bullet_2: Developed, performed and wrote manuscript for collaborative bioinformatics research project in less than one week.

Title: Community Research Education and Engagement for Data Science (CREEDS)
Institution: Icahn School of Medicine at Mount Sinai
Bullet_1: Intensive summer school in high-performance computing, coding, genome database utilization and bioinformatics methods including transcriptomics and genetic association testing.

Title: Laboratory for Evolutionary Neuroscience
Bullet_1: Thesis: Evolution of the Hippocampus and Adult Neurogenesis Research
Bullet_2: Investigated the evolution of human-specific cognitive abilities and neurological disease susceptibilities (e.g. Alzheimer's Disease).
Bullet_3: Focused on neuroanatomical, transcriptomic and genomic evolution of the human hippocampus and memory.

Title: Project: The Effects of Exercise on Marmoset Models of Multiple Sclerosis
Institution: Trinity University / Southwestern National Primate Research Center
Bullet_1: Investigated the neurobiological mechanisms underlying the ameliorating effects of exercise on relapse-remitting Multiple Sclerosis.

Title: Koobi Foora Field School
Institution: The George Washington University / Rutgers University
Bullet_1: Served as Teaching Assistant while excavating Lower Paleolithic hominin sites (Homo, Paranthropus).
Bullet_2: As Project Leader, investigated the running biomechanics of local Daasanach tribespeople while mentoring undergraduate students.

Title: Laboratory for Evolutionary Neuroanatomy
Bullet_1: Performed dissection, histology, microscopy and quantitative stereology in post-mortem primate brain tissues.
Bullet_3: Trained junior and senior personnel on lab protocols.

Title: Social Cognition Laboratory
Department: Department of Speech, Language & Hearing Sciences
Bullet_1: Organized and trained dozens of undergraduates to conduct weekly cognitive development research; designed and/or directly contributed to over 15 research projects in two years.

Title: Field-school in Paleoanthropology and Paleolithic Archaeology
Institution: University of Winnipeg / University of Belgrade
Department: Department of Anthropology / Department of Archaeology
Supervisor: Mirjana Roksandic, PhD / Dušan Mihailovic, PhD
Bullet_1: Excavated Paleolithic fossils and tools (H. heidelbergensis, H. neanderthalensis) at Mala Balanica, Velika Balanica, and Pešturina sites.

Title: Field School for Quaternary Paleoanthropology and Prehistory
Bullet_1: Excavated Paleolithic fossils and tools from Cueva Negra (H. heidelbergensis) and Sima de las Palomas (H. neanderthalensis) with an international research team.

Title: Project: Comparative 3D skeletal morpology of primates
Bullet_1: Contributed to paleoanthropological research on primate fossils using 3D morphometry imaging equipment including Minolta, Microscribe and CT.

Title: Princeton Neuroscience Institute Research Internship
Supervisor: Marieke van Vugt, PhD / Jonathan Cohen, PhD
Bullet_1: Investigated the neural basis of decision-making in humans.
Bullet_2: Recruited participants, recorded EEG and analyzed data in MATLAB.

Title: Undergraduate Course Research
Department: Department of Cognitive, Linguistic & Psychological Sciences
Supervisor: Robert G. Cook, PhD / Rebecca Burwell, PhD
Bullet_1: Experimental Analysis of Animal Behavior & Cognition: Conducted various operant conditioning experiments on rats. Gained experience in animal behavioral training, data collection, and data analysis in MATLAB.
Bullet_2: Laboratory in Genes and Behavior: Tested transgenic mice with modified N-type voltage-gated calcium channel subunits in a battery of cognitive and sensorimotor tasks. Results were published.
